author: _shemnon
content:
Summary from today's call
* Besu, evmone, and Reth each reported progression to a full implementation
* EIP-663 will be reviewed and merged with the EXCHANGE opcode
* Max call stack depth (1024)  will be preserved on new CALLs and CREATEs even though it needs a half trillion gas.  Same semantics as before
* We need to get feedback from Solidity and prolific gas golfers like SoLady WRT the flipped returns on EXT*CALL and user experience with low level `call` function and assembly blocks.
* One last name change, EXTCALL, EXTDELEGAGECALL, and EXTSTATICCALL (which I'm estatic about)
* To discuss next week, moving RETURNDATACOPY to zero padded instead of index failures.  There are no tests for this so it is a good time to change

author: chfast
content: Do you you mean by "there are no tests for this"?

author: _shemnon
content: "no reference tests for this yet " - updated

author: _shemnon
content: or I may have missed the reference tests.
